pageContext.claim: “I probably left Singapore four or five months ago. And we made more progress [on North Korea] in that four or five months than they've made in 70 years. And nobody else could have done what I've done.”
pageContext.analysis: The status quo has not changed as it relates to North Korea's nuclear ambitions. Bill Clinton negotiated a nuclear agreement with North Korea that froze its plutonium program and was working on a missile deal. But that agreement fell apart under George W. Bush. Then Bush tried to negotiate a deal, even lifting sanctions on North Korea. But those tentative agreements fell apart as well and Obama was unable to make much more progress. Trump signed a vague joint statement on denuclearization with Kim Jong Un at a summit meeting June 12, but there has not been substantial progress after that.
